meanings.sent1: The rabbit bolted when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She bolted out of the room when she saw a spider.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel bolted away with the last acorn, leaving the others surprised.
meanings.sent4: As soon as the bell rang, the students bolted out of the classroom like a stampede.
meanings.sent5: The cat bolted up the tree to escape the barking dog.

meanings.definition: To secure or fasten with a bolt
meanings.sent1: He bolted the door before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: She bolted the shelf to the wall to make it sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter bolted the pieces of wood together with precision.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic bolted the engine back into place after repairing it.
meanings.sent5: She quickly bolted the gate shut to keep the dog from running away.

meanings.definition: A metal pin or bar used to fasten things together
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a bolt to secure the two pieces of wood.
meanings.sent2: She needed a bolt to fix the broken chair leg.
meanings.sent3: The bolt rolled off the table and onto the floor, making a clinking sound.
meanings.sent4: The gate wouldn't close properly without the missing bolt.
meanings.sent5: He found a rusty bolt in the toolbox that he used to fix the loose handle.
